entries.meaning: (baseball) A pitch thrown with the ball gripped on the fingertips and released with no rotation, which travels over an unpredictable path to the plate due to micro-turbulence in the air.
examples: Even the pitcher doesn't know where his knuckleball is going.
Boston Red Sox pitcher Tim Wakefield is best known for his use of the knuckleball.

entries.meaning: (figurative) An event that is hard to predict.
examples: Our vendor keeps throwing us knuckleballs.

verbs.description: knuckleball (third-person singular simple present knuckleballs, present participle knuckleballing, simple past and past participle knuckleballed)
